title: Harry Noon
text:
Harry Noon (6 October 1937 – 2 September 1996) was an English professional <a href="association%20football">football</a> player and coach.
Career.
Born in <a href="Sutton-in-Ashfield">Sutton-in-Ashfield</a>, Noon played as a <a href="Defender%20%28association%20football%29">full back</a> for Bentinck Methodists, <a href="Notts%20County%20F.C.">Notts County</a>, <a href="Bradford%20City%20A.F.C.">Bradford City</a> and <a href="Wisbech%20Town%20F.C.">Wisbech Town</a>.
He joined Bradford City in July 1962 and left them in February 1963. During his time with the club, he made one appearance in <a href="the%20Football%20League">the Football League</a> and one appearance in the <a href="FA%20Cup">FA Cup</a>.
He later moved to Australia, where he was coach of <a href="Sydney%20United%20FC">Sydney Croatia</a> during the 1984 season. He died in Sydney on 2 September 1996.
